title: Adobe Express Guide: Logging into Adobe Express with Okta SSO
content: This is a step-by-step guide for logging into Adobe Express using Okta and Single Sign-On (SSO). üîê Enhanced Security with Okta SSO At Simplifi, we prioritize security by leveraging Okta SSO for accessing platforms like Adobe Express. This method provides significantly enhanced security compared to the less secure AdobeID, which relies on traditional username/password authentication. While Adobe fully supports Okta authentication, the actual login process is initiated on the Adobe side. For your convenience, an Adobe application tile is readily available on your Okta dashboard, designed to direct you straight to the login page. :steps: Steps to Log In to Adobe Express: Follow these steps to securely log in to Adobe Express using your Simplifi credentials: Access Okta Dashboard : First, log into your Okta dashboard by navigating to login.simpli.fi . Use Adobe Bookmark Tile : On your Okta dashboard, locate and click the bookmark icon tile for Adobe Express. [Image] :email: Continue with Email : This action will lead you to the Adobe Express page. Click "Continue with email" to proceed. [Image] :email: Enter Simplifi Email : On the subsequent sign-in page, type your Simplifi email address into the designated field. Then, click "Continue." [Image] üè¢ Select Company or School Account : A new page will appear. You might see a similar view or only the "Company or School Account" option. Select "Company or School Account" to proceed with the Okta authentication flow. [Image] Upon completing these steps, you should be successfully signed into your Adobe dashboard, granting you full access to Adobe Express . :troubleshooting: Authentication & Troubleshooting Okta Promptw : If you are not already signed into Okta and access the Adobe Express login page directly, you will be prompted for your Okta credentials. MFA Prompts : There may be times when you are prompted for MFA (Multi-Factor Authentication), even if you are already signed into Okta. This is a normal part of Adobe's session cookie processing and helps maintain a secure connection for your Adobe Express session. [Image] There is an Okta icon in your Chrome toolbar for quick and easy access to ALL your apps? If you don't see it, click the puzzle piece then click the pin next to Okta Browser plugin. From here you can quickly log in to your account and quick access to ALL your apps! ¬† [Image] [Image] ¬† ¬† ¬† [Image]
